item.title: ICE plans new enforcement facility in OKC
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has plans for a new facility in Oklahoma City around I-40 and Meridian. It is designed to provide offices for up to 65 professional staff from the agency’s Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) a rezoning request with the City of Oklahoma City shows. The rezoning application states ERO is […]

The post ICE plans new enforcement facility in OKC appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: New OKC muni courthouse designed for public access, ease
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Judge Philippa James has been on the Oklahoma City Municipal Court bench for 20 years and has lived with the problems of the old building that long. She was ready for a new space. And so, she started the ribbon-cutting ceremony for the new Municipal Court Building with a big smile and said “let’s get […]

The post New OKC muni courthouse designed for public access, ease appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: MLK Day – “We have work to do!”
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
“We have work to do!” was a persistent theme among the African-American speakers Sunday and Monday marking the birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr. But even one Latina participant spontaneously said something similar in an interview with Free Press. It was a level of urgency to organize that has not been present in the recent […]

The post MLK Day – “We have work to do!” appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Dollens continues to connect with local people first
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Mickey Dollens continues to do what helped him win the HD 93 seat in November. He keeps his ear tuned carefully to his local constituents and also to people on the south side of Oklahoma City who are neighbors to his district. And so the informal, but always well-attended Capitol Hill Civic group is one […]
